content.description: Start with hands low on the shelf on the face right of the overhang. Move up using only arete holds. A small crimp is crucial to getting to the jug ledges. Same finish as Average Joe, just don't use the holds on the face.
content.location: Looking at the slab wall with Classic and Left of Waterfall, walk to the left down the path for about 30 seconds and this boulder will be on the right.

content.description: Go up the overhang using only somewhat crimpy holds on the overhang face. Arete holds are off. There is one crimp close to it that's on (the red line in the pic passes through it.
content.location: Looking at the slab wall with Classic and Left of Waterfall, walk to the left down the path for about 30 seconds and this boulder will be on the right.

content.description: Start low with hands to the right on the obvious shelf underneath the overhang. Move up to the small ledge hold at the end of the roof. Use some less-obvious pockets and ledges on the left to move up to a good top out hold on the right side of the boulder.
content.location: Next to the RIP trail on the East side of the Witches' Circle. One of the first boulders you'll see on the right coming from the north, one of the last boulders you'll see on the left coming from the south.

content.description: To the right of the waterfall is an arete above a very overhanging mini-roof. This problem begins on the right side of that roof shelf, traverses across it to the left, reaches in for a good slot before making the crux bump up to a decent intermediate on the face to the left of the arete, and then tops out by way of a big jug on the arete.I'm certain I'm not the first person to touch this piece of this rock, so let me know if it already has a name.
content.protection: One pad for the crux is fine
content.location: If you're looking at the slab wall that has the waterfall on it, it's on the far right, starting just around the small corner at the rightmost part of the huge shelf.

content.description: Amazing line. Named Operation because it's hard to get out of the start without dabbing. SDS on the green holds pictured and work up on jugs until you're at the roof. Use the sloper rail on the roof to work onto the edge of the boulder. Come up from the front side of the boulder and heel hook mantle.
content.location: Located off of the RIP trail, about 30 feet to the left of the RIP boulder. The very obvious diving board shaped rock.

content.description: Grab the obvious undercling feature, step Off the Rocks and step onto the wall. Work your way out left to a good edge, then up and over. Crux is getting off the start.
content.location: To the left of Jitters and RIP, on the left side of the Wave Wall

content.description: Start with a left hand on a sloper just below the big undercling feature, right hand somewhere in the strange crack near the ground. Figure out a way to stand up, same finish as the stand start version.
content.location: In the middle of the Wave Wall, just to the left of Jitters and RIP.

content.description: Another good slab problem on this wall. Start matched in a good pocket and move right to another. Move up to good ledges or use the slopers in between. Stay to the left of the mossy waterfall - don't top out too early!
content.location: To the right of Classic, on the slab wall on the western side of the Witches' Circle

content.description: Start low on the left side of the shelf underneath the overhang. Move up and left to a good pocket. Use a sloper to bump or just go for the next ledge a few feet up. There's a good left hand hold for topping out.
content.location: Just to the left of RIP V2. Next to the RIP trail on the East side of the Witches' Circle. One of the first boulders you'll see on the right coming from the north, one of the last boulders you'll see on the left coming from the south.

content.description: SDS on a good left ledge and a strange right crimp. Reach out to the tip of the horn/knob. Move up and right on crimps until you can grab a key pinch. Match, get a high foot on the horn, mantle, and walk up carefully.
content.location: Off of the RIP trail. Directly to the left of the Operation boulder, about 30 feet to the left of the RIP boulder.

content.description: Same start as RIP, but instead of using the holds on the left, go straight up. A surprisingly committing lowball.
content.location: Same start as RIP. Next to the RIP trail on the East side of the Witches' Circle. One of the first boulders you'll see on the right coming from the north, one of the last boulders you'll see on the left coming from the south.Â

content.description: One of the best looking boulders at this spot. Start on the more obvious sloping shelf on the right side of the wall. Work your way left and up on a myriad of crimps and good feet until you can gain the lip and top out.
content.location: On the right side of the Wave Wall, this climb rides the wave. Just to the left of Jitters and RIP.

content.description: Sit start with hands on a good edge below the largest "hole" in the wall and move up to the hole. Move straight up with high feet and smears through the various cracks and slots in the rock.
content.location: On the slab wall on the western side of the Witches' Circle

content.description: Start sitting with hands matched on the low crimp to the left of the arete. Move up and right to a good pocket, then use the arete holds to finish.Â
content.protection: Multiple pads for the boulder behind the climb and the sloped landing
content.location: On the Slim boulder, to the left of the slab wall, on the western side of the Witches' Circle

content.description: Located at a sundial locally known as "The Witches' Circle", this patch of boulders features many nice sandstone overhangs and a few good slab problems.
